result.execSummary:
The defendant Sheldon D Tepp was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Probation may be transferred to Fond du lac County or any other county.
Apply 79 days credit, if revoked.

miscConds.notes:
Court costs ($268) and DNA surcharge ($250) - cash bail applied.  Balance of costs to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.
AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.

ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit to random urine screens.
No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
Provide DNA sample if not yet provided.
Not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged and distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (for example, bars, taverns or liquor stores).

timeConds.notes:
Non - working hours with all Standard Release Conditions.
STAYED.
To be used at Agent's discretion.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Margaret Drees appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Sheldon D Tepp in court with attorney Stephen P. Rypel.  

Defendant plead Guilty to count 1.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of count 1.
Count 2 is dismissed as a read-in.

Court orders the following:
Count 1:

SENTENCE WITHHELD;
79 Days Credit if revoked.

TERM OF PROBATION: 3 YEAR(S);
Probation may be transferred to Fon Du Lac County or anyother County.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done.
Not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (i.e bars, taverns, or liquor stores).

COSTS:  $268
DNA Sample (if not already provided) and SURCHARGE:  $250
Bail to be Applied.
Balance to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

CONDITION TIME:
60 Days in the Waukesha County Jail w/huber (all standard release conditions) - Non-Working Hours.
Stay.
To be used at the discretion of the Agent. 

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.

Detainer lift.
